TopicTitle: The most Kerbal real airplane ever flown?

Articles.Content:
http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/9333-Caproni-Ca-60-Noviplano

I'd love to see someone make that in KSP .23, taking advantage of the nifty mods like procedural wings. There were many even crazier designs from the first 20 or so years after 1903, but most of them couldn't actually fly.

The Caproni Ca.60 Noviplano did fly, until it crashed, then caught fire and burned. Caproni also built some other really crazy aircraft. The man was a Kerbal in human form.

Cracked.com has something: http://www.cracked.com/article_19330_8-wtf-aircraft-designs-that-actually-caught-air.html

And if in-game, behold... the most WTF design I've ever done (yet flew): The Skeleplane.
I have an approximation of the Ca-60, the Kerboni-Kerbiplano, engines are way too powerful and the props too big but it can cruise at around 80mph and take off and land on water.
I vote for the ryan x-13 vertijet, or its german counterpart but tht one was only a concept i believe. Srry im not at to comp atm or id add pics

The Bumblebee, which I've seen at the Pima Air Museum - smallest manned plane ever flown (at least in 1984). Also the Gee Bee racing plane. If you want something akin to that Caproni, try the Langley Aerodrome.

Edited January 20, 2014 by JenBurdoo
The PZL Wilga has a Kerbal look about it.
